intro: Memecylon pedunculatum var. centrale, commonly known as the central memecylon, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
